job_title: Principal Product Manager - Data & ML Platform
job_description:
Job Description Summary
As a Principal Product Manager of Data & ML Platform at GEHealthCare, you’ll support the Command Center product with a focus on data infrastructure, analytics infrastructure and tooling and AI/ML platform. Command Center helps hospitals and health systems care for patients more efficiently, effectively and with higher quality. It coordinates scattered healthcare data, complex protocols, and siloed care teams and offers a real-time decision and collaboration platform at the patient, unit, department, health system and regional level. As result, health systems unlock capacity, improve length of stay, and create a predictable patient flow.

As a Principal Product Manager, you will help the Command Center define and deliver on its next generation data and ML infrastructure that is the core platform from which all applications are built and both product and services value is derived. Because Command Center is used by so many health systems in the U.S and worldwide, you will be in a unique position to advance the future of operational and clinical innovation which depends on access to vast amounts of structured and unstructured data as well as the most advanced AIML techniques such as generative AI. You’ll have the opportunity to engage with cross functional technical teams across GEHC, customer facing field teams and analysts, as well as the customers to deeply understand how we design the data & ML platform can drive better value creation.

This role is part of GEHealthCare’s Science & Technology Organization (STO). STO is harnessing the power of technology to make healthcare more precise, personalized, and accessible for everyone. From driving the overall clinical research and patient-centric innovation strategy to delivering new digital and machine learning capabilities. We’re committed to leading digital transformation, improving outcomes for patients and providers, and creating a world where healthcare has no limits. To find out more, visit: https://jobs.gecareers.com/science-technology

As a Principal Product Manager, you will help the Command Center product differentiate, discover new use cases, and deliver the next generation of customer value. Because Command Center is used by so many health systems in the U.S and worldwide, you will be in a unique position to advance the future of operational and clinical innovation. You’ll have the opportunity to engage with providers, nurses, and operational staff across the entire heath system. You may lead market and user research and manage a diverse set of stakeholders.

This role is part of GEHealthCare’s Science & Technology Organization (STO). STO is harnessing the power of technology to make healthcare more precise, personalized, and accessible for everyone. From driving the overall clinical research and patient-centric innovation strategy to delivering new digital and machine learning capabilities. We’re committed to leading digital transformation, improving outcomes for patients and providers, and creating a world where healthcare has no limits. To find out more, visit: https://jobs.gecareers.com/science-technology

Job Description

What you’ll do:
• Deeply understand the Command Center product and its customers, workflows and pain points and how data enables this
• Deeply understand the services teams analytic pain points, processes, and desired future state and how data enables this
• Deep understand the Command Center architecture and technology, translating and creating a roadmap from current state to future state based on customer and services requirements
• Own the product data and ML infrastructure requirements, roadmap, and priorities
• Translate business and customer requirements into technical priorities and roadmap
• Partner with engineering leadership within the Command Center team and with centralized tech services to create an aligned roadmap forward
• Drive cross functional role, ownership, and scope clarity
• Coordinate across technical teams towards execution and delivery of roadmap
• Explore new analytics use case ideas and inform product strategy and roadmap for data, analytics and AI/ML
• Do all the things you’d expect from a product manager, like driving planning, prioritization, defining requirements, and collaborating across engineering, data science, UX, sales, marketing, etc.
• Work in a matrixed environment

You’ll love this job if you:
• Love healthcare and hospitals, and their complex data
• Love telling and visualizing stories with data
• Love being an expert in the behind-the-scenes platform / infrastructure
• Thrive in environments of high complexity and high impact
• Thrive in working with technical teams and leadership
• Are energized when working with people and diverse stakeholders
• Have a learning mindset
• Lead with humility, curiosity, and a data-drive mindset

Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree
• 8 years industry experience
• 5 years product management experience
• Experience with healthcare / hospital data and analytics
• Experience with data infrastructure / platform / back-end
• Experience working with agile development teams
• Experience defining product requirements and using data and metrics to determine outcomes

Desired Qualifications:
• B2B healthcare product experience
• Experience with AI/ML
• Experience with data visualization, reporting and BI tooling
• BS in Computer Science or related technical degree

Eligibility Requirements:
• The ability to travel 50-60%
• GE HealthCare may choose to sponsor visas as business needs dictate.
• GE HealthCare will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a significant value on work-life balance. Having a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We don’t focus on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We maintain diverse engineering, and leadership perspectives and backgrounds across technology and beyond. Our employees are excited to share their experiences and mentor more junior engineers. Team members are highly encouraged to set up mentorship relationships with seasoned engineers, not only in our team, but also across the broader GE Healthcare population.

Inclusive Team Culture
• Here at GE HealthCare, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have many employee-led affinity groups, innovative benefit offerings, and encourage ongoing learning experiences.

#LI-HT1 #LI-SEA #LI-HYBRID

For U.S. based positions only, the pay range for this position is $152,592.00-$228,888.00 Annual. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the pay range and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including skills, qualifications, experience and location. In addition, this position may also be eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). GE HealthCare offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, and tuition reimbursement.

GE HealthCare offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE HealthCare will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

While GE HealthCare does not currently require U.S. employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, some GE HealthCare customers have vaccination mandates that may apply to certain GE HealthCare employees.

Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes

Qualifications: Love healthcare and hospitals, and their complex data
Love telling and visualizing stories with data
Love being an expert in the behind-the-scenes platform / infrastructure
Thrive in environments of high complexity and high impact
Are energized when working with people and diverse stakeholders
Lead with humility, curiosity, and a data-drive mindset
Experience with healthcare / hospital data and analytics
Experience with data infrastructure / platform / back-end
Experience working with agile development teams
Experience defining product requirements and using data and metrics to determine outcomes
